ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Threads wait in phase "ABOUT_TO_GET_URI" for minutes
ygData.msgSnippet: Generally this means nothing is ready to be crawled. Check the frontier report; are any queues in the ready state? If not, threads wait until a queue can

Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Threads wait in phase "ABOUT_TO_GET_URI" for
 minutes
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=_IeINgE3_dV2pqtjpR9HhV6n4ndqf_P6PX1KM2vWU7Rd
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

Generally this means nothing is ready to be crawled. Check the frontier 
report; are any queues in the 'ready' state? If not, threads wait until 
a queue can provide a URI.

If queues are in a multi-minute 'snoozed' state, that means a connection 
to the site failed and the queue has gone into slow-retry.

 From the indications of your crawl parameters in other messages, if you 
are using those settings against any sites not under your direct 
control, it would not surprise me if sites haven't started blocking you 
for aggressive crawling (either via automatic or manual mechanisms).

What User-Agent are you using, and what contact information have you 
provided webmasters if your crawler is creating problems?

- Gordon @ IA

On 12/21/10 1:53 AM, yotpo.official wrote:
> Hi, I monitored the threads in order to understand why not all of the threads are active. I noticed that threads wait in line in the phase:
> ABOUT_TO_GET_URI for minutes. How can I reduce the time? Here is what I get in the Toe-Threads log file:

>   -no CrawlURI-
>      WAITING for 1m53s594ms

> Java Thread State: TIMED_WAITING
> Blocked/Waiting On: NONE

>      org.archive.crawler.frontier.AbstractFrontier.next(AbstractFrontier.java:432)

> ]
